Articles.Content:
How far apart can parts get before they become unattached?  In the picture below, you can see a fair bit of daylight between the different parts making up this basic plane.  I had accidentally reversed the thrust on only one of the two wing mounted engines, causing it to go into a very rapid spin.  Once I had regained control, some of the parts had altered the angle of attachment to the next.

Spoiler

I would have thought my plane would have disintegrated long before it reached this stage!

Regards

Clipperridde

Edited October 15, 2016 by Clipperride
Let me guess.... You have autostruts turned on? I will say that if you can keep that thing flying and perhaps even land it, I will be extremely impressed.
Hmmmm. I tested this sort of thing early in beta, and my planes did disintegrate a long time before they got to that state. I'll have to test again. But yeah, autostruts is a great guess.

Nope - none of the advanced tweakables were turned on, so no auto struts and no rigid parts.

When I managed to recover from the spin, one engine had detached and the command pod had reattached at an odd angle (I'd guess about 10° "bent" to one side).  I didn't manage to get a screenshot of that sadly.

The good news was a "landing" of sorts (ie Jeb didn't die) by coming down tail first into the sea.  The plane (The Jeb Flyer - it being the first plane I've built in 1.2) did smash itself to pieces but in one of those lucky KSP events, when the cockpit broke loose it came down at a survivable velocity! Definitely far more luck than skill in getting the little chap back home in time for snacks and medals.
PS Just had a thought about the above picture - How Do I check that I turned on aerodynamic damage when I created my 1.2 save?  If it's "off" it might explain what was going on.
Check in the Cheats tab, in the debug menu, for whether "unbreakable joints" is activated. Yes, that would indeed explain it -- it may have gotten set without you knowing.
Thanks @bewing I shall have a look-see.  Flying a plane (other than in a dead straight line, heading for orbit) in KSP is finally fun!
